page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA.
page.content: Most of the area is farmland.There is a small residential area in one corner and there are many farms.The main farms are{Bilton Barns}and{ {Greenrigg.}There are two small villages,called Lesbury and Hipsburn. Lesbury got its name from the leeches which lived in the river.Hipsburn originated from the stepping stones across the river.Lesbury is made up mainly from stone cottages, whilst Hipsburn has more modern brick buildings.There is an old church at Lesbury dating from the twelfth century.{Wooden Farm,}on the outskirts of Hipsburn,was built where a pack of wolves once roamed.It was also bombarded by the famous American privateer,John Paul Jones,in the war of 1812.
